paragraphs.text: I once knew someone who spent a year in a plaster cast recovering from an operation on his back.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ wʌns njuː ˈsʌmwʌn huː spɛnt ə jɪər ɪn ə ˈplɑːstər kɑːst rɪˈkʌvərɪŋ frɒm ən ˌɒpəˈreɪʃən ɒn hɪz bæk/

paragraphs.text: He read a lot and thought a lot and felt miserable.
paragraphs.ipa: /hiː rɛd ə lɒt ænd θɔːt ə lɒt ænd fɛlt ˈmɪzərəbl/

paragraphs.text: Later he realised this time of forced retreat from the world had helped him to understand the world more clearly.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈleɪtə hiː ˈrɪəlaɪzd ðɪs taɪm əv fɔːst rɪˈtriːt frɒm ðə wɜːld hæd hɛlpt hɪm tuː ˌʌndəˈstænd ðə wɜːld mɔː ˈklɪəli/

paragraphs.text: We all need to get the balance right between action and reflection.
paragraphs.ipa: /wiː ɔːl niːd tuː ɡɛt ðə ˈbæləns raɪt bɪˈtwiːn ˈækʃən ænd rɪˈflɛkʃən/

paragraphs.text: With so many distractions, it is easy to forget to pause and take stock.
paragraphs.ipa: /wɪð səʊ ˈmɛni dɪsˈtrækʃənz, ɪt ɪz ˈiːzi tuː fəˈɡɛt tuː pɔːz ænd teɪk stɒk/

paragraphs.text: Be it through contemplation, prayer, or even keeping a diary.
paragraphs.ipa: /biː ɪt θruː ˌkɒntəmˈpleɪʃən, preə, ɔːr ˈiːvən ˈkiːpɪŋ ə ˈdaɪəri/

paragraphs.text: Many have found the practice of quiet personal reflection surprisingly rewarding, even discovering greater spiritual depth to their lives.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈmɛni hæv faʊnd ðə ˈpræktɪs əv ˈkwaɪət ˈpɜːsənəl rɪˈflɛkʃən səˈpraɪzɪŋli rɪˈwɔːdɪŋ, ˈiːvən dɪsˈkʌvərɪŋ ˈɡreɪtə ˈspɪrɪtjʊəl dɛpθ tuː ðeə laɪvz/

paragraphs.text: Reflection can take many forms.
paragraphs.ipa: /rɪˈflɛkʃən kæn teɪk ˈmɛni fɔːmz/

paragraphs.text: When families and friends come together at Christmas, it's often a time for happy memories and reminiscing.
paragraphs.ipa: /wɛn ˈfæmɪliz ænd frɛndz kʌm təˈɡɛðər æt ˈkrɪsməs, ɪts ˈɒfən ə taɪm fɔː ˈhæpi ˈmɛməriz ænd ˌrɛmɪˈnɪsɪŋ/

paragraphs.text: Our thoughts are with those we have loved who are no longer with us.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈaʊə θɔːts ɑː wɪð ðəʊz wiː hæv lʌvd huː ɑː nəʊ ˈlɒŋɡə wɪð ʌs/

paragraphs.text: We also remember those who, through doing their duty, cannot be at home for Christmas, such as workers in essential emergency services.
paragraphs.ipa: /wiː ˈɔːlsəʊ rɪˈmɛmbə ðəʊz huː, θruː ˈduːɪŋ ðeə ˈdjuːti, ˈkænɒt biː æt həʊm fɔː ˈkrɪsməs, sʌʧ æz ˈwɜːkəz ɪn ɪˈsɛnʃəl ɪˈmɜːʤənsi ˈsɜːvɪsɪz/

analysis.purpose: Honor those serving away from home

paragraphs.text: And especially at this time of year, we think of the men and women serving overseas in our armed forces.
paragraphs.ipa: /ænd ɪˈspɛʃəli æt ðɪs taɪm əv jɪər, wiː θɪŋk əv ðə mɛn ænd ˈwɪmɪn ˈsɜːvɪŋ ˈəʊvəˈsiːz ɪn ˈaʊə ɑːmd ˈfɔːsɪz/

paragraphs.text: We are forever grateful to all those who put themselves at risk to keep us safe.
paragraphs.ipa: /wiː ɑː fərˈɛvə ˈɡreɪtfʊl tuː ɔːl ðəʊz huː pʊt ðəmˈsɛlvz æt rɪsk tuː kiːp ʌs seɪf/

paragraphs.text: Service and duty are not just the guiding principles of yesteryear.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈsɜːvɪs ænd ˈdjuːti ɑː nɒt ʤʌst ðə ˈɡaɪdɪŋ ˈprɪnsəpəlz əv ˈjɛstəjɪə/

paragraphs.text: They have an enduring value which spans the generations.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðeɪ hæv ən ɪnˈdjʊərɪŋ ˈvæljuː wɪʧ spænz ðə ˌʤɛnəˈreɪʃənz/

paragraphs.text: I myself had cause to reflect this year at Westminster Abbey on my own pledge of service made in that great church on coronation Day 60 years earlier.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ maɪˈsɛlf hæd kɔːz tuː rɪˈflɛkt ðɪs jɪər æt ˈwɛstmɪnstər ˈæbi ɒn maɪ əʊn plɛʤ əv ˈsɜːvɪs meɪd ɪn ðæt ɡreɪt ʧɜːʧ ɒn ˌkɒrəˈneɪʃən deɪ ˈsɪksti jɪəz ˈɜːlɪə/

paragraphs.text: All this I promised to do.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɔːl ðɪs aɪ ˈprɒmɪst tuː duː/

paragraphs.text: Today we celebrate 60 years since that moment, 60 years of commitment.
paragraphs.ipa: /təˈdeɪ wiː ˈsɛlɪbreɪt ˈsɪksti jɪəz sɪns ðæt ˈməʊmənt, ˈsɪksti jɪəz əv kəˈmɪtmənt/

paragraphs.text: The anniversary reminded me of the remarkable changes that have occurred since the coronation, many of them for the better, and of the things that have remained constant, such as the importance of family, friendship and good neighborliness.
paragraphs.ipa: /ði ˌænɪˈvɜːsəri rɪˈmaɪndɪd miː əv ðə rɪˈmɑːkəbl ˈʧeɪnʤɪz ðæt hæv əˈkɜːd sɪns ðə ˌkɒrəˈneɪʃən, ˈmɛni əv ðɛm fɔː ðə ˈbɛtə, ænd əv ðə θɪŋz ðæt hæv rɪˈmeɪnd ˈkɒnstənt, sʌʧ æz ði ɪmˈpɔːtəns əv ˈfæmɪli, ˈfrɛndʃɪp ænd ɡʊd ˈneɪbəlɪnɪs/

paragraphs.text: But reflection is not just about looking back.
paragraphs.ipa: /bʌt rɪˈflɛkʃən ɪz nɒt ʤʌst əˈbaʊt ˈlʊkɪŋ bæk/

paragraphs.text: I and many others are looking forward to the Commonwealth Games in Glasgow next year.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ ænd ˈmɛni ˈʌðəz ɑː ˈlʊkɪŋ ˈfɔːwəd tuː ðə ˈkɒmənwelθ ɡeɪmz ɪn ˈɡlɑːzɡəʊ nɛkst jɪə/

paragraphs.text: The Battle Relay left London in October and is now the other side of the world, on its way across 70 nations and territories before arriving in Scotland next summer.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðə ˈbætl ˈriːleɪ lɛft ˈlʌndən ɪn ɒkˈtəʊbər ænd ɪz naʊ ði ˈʌðə saɪd əv ðə wɜːld, ɒn ɪts weɪ əˈkrɒs ˈsɛvənti ˈneɪʃənz ænd ˈtɛrɪtəriz bɪˈfɔːr əˈraɪvɪŋ ɪn ˈskɒtlənd nɛkst ˈsʌmə/

paragraphs.text: Its journey is a reminder that the Commonwealth can offer us a fresh view of life.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪts ˈʤɜːni ɪz ə rɪˈmaɪndə ðæt ðə ˈkɒmənwelθ kæn ˈɒfər ʌs ə frɛʃ vjuː əv laɪf/

paragraphs.text: My son Charles summed this up at the recent meeting in Sri Lanka.
paragraphs.ipa: /maɪ sʌn ʧɑːlz sʌmd ðɪs ʌp æt ðə ˈriːsənt ˈmiːtɪŋ ɪn sriː ˈlæŋkə/

paragraphs.text: He spoke of the Commonwealth's family ties that are a source of encouragement to many.
paragraphs.ipa: /hiː spəʊk əv ðə ˈkɒmənwelθs ˈfæmɪli taɪz ðæt ɑːr ə sɔːs əv ɪnˈkʌrɪʤmənt tuː ˈmɛni/

paragraphs.text: Each one of us is here because of the hope and the trust we place in the Commonwealth to bring that touch of healing to our troubles and deliver the very best future for our people.
paragraphs.ipa: /iːʧ wʌn əv ʌs ɪz hɪə bɪˈkɒz əv ðə həʊp ænd ðə trʌst wiː pleɪs ɪn ðə ˈkɒmənwelθ tuː brɪŋ ðæt tʌʧ əv ˈhiːlɪŋ tuː ˈaʊə ˈtrʌblz ænd dɪˈlɪvə ðə ˈvɛri bɛst ˈfjuːʧə fɔːr ˈaʊə ˈpiːpl/

paragraphs.text: Like any family, there can be differences of opinion, but however strongly they're expressed, they are held within the common bond of friendship and shared experiences here at home.
paragraphs.ipa: /laɪk ˈɛni ˈfæmɪli, ðeə kæn biː ˈdɪfərənsɪz əv əˈpɪnjən, bʌt haʊˈɛvə ˈstrɒŋli ðeər ɪksˈprɛst, ðeɪ ɑː hɛld wɪˈðɪn ðə ˈkɒmən bɒnd əv ˈfrɛndʃɪp ænd ʃeəd ɪksˈpɪərɪənsɪz hɪər æt həʊm/

paragraphs.text: My own family is a little larger this Christmas, as so many of you will know.
paragraphs.ipa: /maɪ əʊn ˈfæmɪli ɪz ə ˈlɪtl ˈlɑːʤə ðɪs ˈkrɪsməs, æz səʊ ˈmɛni əv juː wɪl nəʊ/

paragraphs.text: The arrival of a baby gives everyone the chance to contemplate the future with renewed happiness and hope for the new parents.
paragraphs.ipa: /ði əˈraɪvəl əv ə ˈbeɪbi ɡɪvz ˈɛvrɪwʌn ðə ʧɑːns tuː ˈkɒntəmpleɪt ðə ˈfjuːʧə wɪð rɪˈnjuːd ˈhæpɪnɪs ænd həʊp fɔːr ðə njuː ˈpeərənts/

paragraphs.text: Life will never be quite the same again.
paragraphs.ipa: /laɪf wɪl ˈnɛvə biː kwaɪt ðə seɪm əˈɡeɪn/

paragraphs.text: As with all who are christened, George was baptized into a joyful faith of Christian duty and service.
paragraphs.ipa: /æz wɪð ɔːl huː ɑː ˈkrɪsənd, ʤɔːʤ wɒz ˈbæptɪzd ˈɪntuː ə ˈʤɔɪfʊl feɪθ əv ˈkrɪstʃən ˈdjuːti ænd ˈsɜːvɪs/

paragraphs.text: After the christening, we gathered for the traditional photograph.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈɑːftə ðə ˈkrɪsənɪŋ, wiː ˈɡæðəd fɔːr ðə trəˈdɪʃənl ˈfəʊtəɡrɑːf/

paragraphs.text: It was a happy occasion, bringing together 4 generations.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪt wɒz ə ˈhæpi əˈkeɪʒən, ˈbrɪŋɪŋ təˈɡɛðə fɔː ˌʤɛnəˈreɪʃənz/

paragraphs.text: In the year ahead, I hope you will have time to pause for moments of quiet reflection.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɪn ðə jɪər əˈhɛd, aɪ həʊp juː wɪl hæv taɪm tuː pɔːz fɔːr ˈməʊmənts əv ˈkwaɪət rɪˈflɛkʃən/

paragraphs.text: As the man in the plaster cast discovered, the results can sometimes be surprising for Christians and for all people of faith.
paragraphs.ipa: /æz ðə mæn ɪn ðə ˈplɑːstər kɑːst dɪsˈkʌvəd, ðə rɪˈzʌlts kæn ˈsʌmtaɪmz biː səˈpraɪzɪŋ fɔː ˈkrɪstʃənz ænd fɔːr ɔːl ˈpiːpl əv feɪθ/

paragraphs.text: Reflection, meditation and prayer help us to renew ourselves in God's love as we strive daily to become better people.
paragraphs.ipa: /rɪˈflɛkʃən, ˌmɛdɪˈteɪʃən ænd preə hɛlp ʌs tuː rɪˈnjuː aʊəˈsɛlvz ɪn ɡɒdz lʌv æz wiː straɪv ˈdeɪli tuː bɪˈkʌm ˈbɛtə ˈpiːpl/

paragraphs.text: The Christmas message shows us that this love is for everyone.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðə ˈkrɪsməs ˈmɛsɪʤ ʃəʊz ʌs ðæt ðɪs lʌv ɪz fɔːr ˈɛvrɪwʌn/

analysis.purpose: Reinforce the universal message of Christmas

paragraphs.text: There is no one beyond its reach.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðeər ɪz nəʊ wʌn bɪˈjɒnd ɪts riːʧ/

paragraphs.text: On the 1st Christmas in the fields above Bethlehem, as they sat in the cold of night watching their resting sheep, the local shepherds must have had no shortage of time for reflection.
paragraphs.ipa: /ɒn ðə fɜːst ˈkrɪsməs ɪn ðə fiːldz əˈbʌv ˈbɛθlɪhɛm, æz ðeɪ sæt ɪn ðə kəʊld əv naɪt ˈwɒʧɪŋ ðeə ˈrɛstɪŋ ʃiːp, ðə ˈləʊkəl ˈʃɛpədz mʌst hæv hæd nəʊ ˈʃɔːtɪʤ əv taɪm fɔːr rɪˈflɛkʃən/

paragraphs.text: Suddenly all this was to change.
paragraphs.ipa: /ˈsʌdənli ɔːl ðɪs wɒz tuː ʧeɪnʤ/

analysis.purpose: Create anticipation for the Christmas story

paragraphs.text: These humble shepherds were the first to hear and ponder the wondrous news of the birth of Christ, the first Noel, the joy of which we celebrate today.
paragraphs.ipa: /ðiːz ˈhʌmbl ˈʃɛpədz wɜː ðə fɜːst tuː hɪər ænd ˈpɒndə ðə ˈwʌndrəs njuːz əv ðə bɜːθ əv kraɪst, ðə fɜːst nəʊˈɛl, ðə ʤɔɪ əv wɪʧ wiː ˈsɛlɪbreɪt təˈdeɪ/

paragraphs.text: I wish you all a very happy Christmas.
paragraphs.ipa: /aɪ wɪʃ juː ɔːl ə ˈvɛri ˈhæpi ˈkrɪsməs/
